text:
Valuable point, but quite obvious. 2-3 yrs at a firm seems to be a trend for most. For reasonably experienced people in India, 25-30% hike is a good baseline to accept a new job. More is better of course. 

It would be great if you can share tips on negotiating higher raise at current firms. Inflation is a good starting point. 

How do you prepare a presentation to justify your ask of 15% or more during the appraisal?

author: shubham jain

text:
I'm a web developer in a company with 60 employees and my salary went from starting salary of 3lac->4->6lac in 2 years. Idk if I should leave for better company or stay with this one. 
Main deterrent to leaving is that the Companies don't want candidates with 3 months notice period, they want immediate joiners. So, it's a big decision to leave a company without having an offer letter ready from another company before resignation. It's like taking a leap of faith.. which can make or break your career!

text:
Don't be emotional dude. That is how employment sector works and institutions has risk management for these type of situations. Also if you dont make enough money or struck doing same thing, do you think company is going to entertain you??. How can companies hire people as contractors, give them 2-3 months notice period criteria and they throw them out the next day. 
Just stop being emotional. Don't know if youre working or still studying. If studying, welcome to real world where companies like TCS, HCL etc hire entry level engineers with Rs 3.5 lakh pa, which is same in 2009.
